sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Joe Biden and Vladimir Putin's telephone call about Ukraine comes to an end and fears of possible invasion remain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Scuffles and arrests as police attempt to break up large anti-Covid rallies in Paris and The Hague.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: After the result of a failed drug test came to light this week, 15-year-old Russian skating star Kamila Valieva will know on Monday whether she is able to continue the Olympics.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Super Bowl is fast approaching and the Los Angeles Rams are getting ready to face the Cincinnati Bengals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A telephone call between Russia's Vladimir Putin and US President Joe Biden did little

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: to de-escalate tensions surrounding Ukraine on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The US stood firm on the decisive response it would take if Russia should invade, while the Kremlin criticised invasion hysteria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The call was preceded by an exchange between Putin and French President Emmanuel Macron, which according to the Kremlin, made little progress.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: However, the calls highlighted one thing, all parties agree dialogue will continue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The US says that intelligence shows that Russia could still invade on short notice and has therefore announced plans to evacuate most of its embassy staff in Kiev.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Germany, Spain, Italy and Belgium are among some states following suit and asking their nationals to leave.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But in Ukraine, citizens remained resilient on Saturday, with thousands protesting on the streets of Kiev to show unity amid fears of a possible invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has encouraged people not to panic and pushed back against what he calls bleak war predictions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: However he did attend police drills in the southern Kherson region, 30 kilometres from Russian-occupied Crimea, on Saturday morning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And he said a Russian attack could happen at any time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: He also told journalists that Ukraine was ready to counter any action.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile joint Russian-Belorussian military exercises continue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: According to Belorussian military, they are expected to go on until February 20.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Russia has continually denied accusations that its thousands of soldiers on Ukraine's border are gathered there to invade.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: There were scenes of chaos on roads leading into Paris on Saturday as a so-called Freedom Convoy attempted to bring the city to a halt in protest at Covid restrictions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Vehicles from all over France started to arrive around 10 o'clock in the morning, inspired by rallies in the Canadian city of Ottawa. Having banned the demonstration, the authorities deployed thousands of police to try to stop and break up the protest. Police arrested dozens of people, used tear gas and towed away vehicles to compounds. But it was clear they were struggling with the sheer number of participants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A similar protest took place in the Netherlands as vehicles, including trucks and agricultural vehicles, attempted to block the city centre and the national parliament.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: One protester told reporters they had prepared for a long standoff.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Come and have a look in this container, see what we've brought with us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We can last a very long time. Have a look through the door. You can tell we're ready for this. Some trucks carried posters calling for the Dutch prime minister to go and vowing to stay the course.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We want our freedom back. In the past, too much freedom has been taken away in all kinds of areas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: That needs to stop. Since the beginning of the pandemic, the Netherlands has weathered some of the strictest anti-COVID measures in Europe, and many people have had enough.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Love, freedom, not a dictatorship, reads the banner.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A tense standoff at a US-Canadian border crossing

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: seemed to be dissolving peacefully on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Demonstrators started to leave with no resistance as Canadian police moved in to disperse the nearly week-long blockade. The protests at the Ambassador Bridge in Ottawa and elsewhere have been aimed at vaccine mandates and other coronavirus restrictions. There's also been an outpouring of fury towards Prime Minister Justin Trudeau who called the demonstrators a fringe of Canadian society.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Many protesters, driving mainly pick-ups and larger trucks, have been spending nights at border rallies, in defiance of warnings to end the blockades that have disrupted trade and production.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Ambassador Bridge is the busiest US-Canadian border crossing, carrying 25% of all trade between the two countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The rallies have been dubbed freedom convoys and have spread to parts of Europe such as France and the Netherlands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The UK Prime Minister is still under pressure to resign over allegations of illegal parties

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: in Downing Street during Covid lockdowns. He's one of around 50 people who've been sent a questionnaire by police in London investigating the accusations over the so-called Partygate affair. So far Johnson has insisted he won't step down and his party's MPs have not launched any official challenge to his leadership. But a recent poll found that 63% of those surveyed think he should resign.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Even before the party gates, he wasn't a reliable person and I think we should get rid of him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I just think it was completely disrespectful and a disregard to all the guidelines that he's put in and everything like that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It just wasn't fair yeah on the people and i think if it was trees and may it should be out of power yeah straight away so he's getting a lot of leeway for it a lot of leeway he's gotten away with a lot yeah for sure i don't think he should be saying no he's good in one way and then he's done wrong in other ways so i think government's all the same anyway. Many of Boris Johnson's party MPs are waiting to see the results not just of the criminal investigation, but also the full version of an internal report by Sue Gray, a senior civil servant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Partygate comes at a critical time for Johnson, who's one of many European leaders trying to find a diplomatic resolution to the Ukraine crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Protests have taken place in Afghanistan against giving over 3 billion euros of Afghan money

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: to the American families of 9-11 victims.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The group of demonstrators condemned US President Joe Biden's order to free up the Afghan assets held in the US, saying it belongs to them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They also called for financial compensation for the thousands of Afghans killed during the last 20 years of war in the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In Iran, firefighters said they managed to put out a fire at Tehran's Grand Bazaar.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The city's fire department said the blaze broke out in the shoemaker's section on Saturday morning and ended up damaging up to 25 shops.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A spokesman for the department said there were no fatalities but two people had been injured.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Both Portugal and Spain are suffering from severe droughts. According to climate scientists,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: it's the worst Portugal has seen in 20 years, with water reservoirs in the country's centre drying out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And in Spain in the last four months, there has been only a quarter of the rainfall there should have been. Low water supplies could create a difficult situation for the coming summer months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Court of Arbitration for Sport should decide on Monday whether 15-year-old figure skater Kamila Valieva is allowed to carry on and compete in the individual events of the Winter Olympics on Tuesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Russian prodigy's emerging career has been into jeopardy over a doping scandal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The journalists who first reported on this story on Wednesday have spoken out of being subjected to threats, abuse or warnings to check their tea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Understandably, all sorts of arguments on all sides and it's not acceptable for that to turn into threats and violence if indeed it did.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I think we all need to take a chill pill, I think people would say when I was younger.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This week, Kamila Valieva helped Russia win gold in the team event.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: She even became the first female skater to land a quadruple jump at an Olympics.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But on Tuesday, a test taken last December flagged for traces of a banned substance, trimethesidine, a drug which is used in the prevention of chest pain, but could also improve physical efficiency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: in the prevention of chest pain but could also improve physical efficiency. The SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, California will soon be the scene of American football

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: madness as the Los Angeles Rams take on the Cincinnati Bengals in the Super Bowl, the biggest sporting event of the year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Rams will be playing at home in an attempt to win the Vince Lombardi trophy, which they've only won once before, in 2000.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Bengals, on the other hand, have never won a Super Bowl before.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Both teams prefer to play in the air and on the offensive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Rams have a slight edge in the standings, but the final should be just like the previous playoff games, very close.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But this year's Super Bowl wants to show once in a lifetime performance both on the field and off.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And it's looking to relaunch the musical performance machine, which has stalled a little due to the health crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: For this, organisers have chosen Micky Guyton and Jenny Aiko to perform the national anthem and America the Beautiful.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And at half-time, the show will feature some of the top names in hip-hop and R&B with Dr Dre, Eminem, Mary J. Blige and Snoop Dogg.
